title: Laura Tohe Presents for Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series December 14, 2022
abstract: The Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series takes place weekly through January 18, 2023. On December 14, 2022 Casa Grande Ruins will host Laura Tohe at 1:00 pm.  Mrs. Tohe will present "More than Pocahontas and Squaws: Indigenous Women Coming into Visibility". The speaker series will continue every Wednesday at 1:00 pm through January 18.

title: December 2022 Events at Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park
abstract: ʻTis the season to break out your calendars and pencil in all the exciting and fun-filled December events at Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park!

image.altText: Two volcanoes erupt and lava reflects into the pre-dawn sky
image.title: Kilauea and Mauna Loa erupt in tandem in Hawai?i Volcanoes National Park
image.caption: Kīlauea and Mauna Loa volcanoes are seen in a rare simultaneous eruption

title: U.S. Park Rangers Seek Information on Trailer Theft at Mesa Verde National Park
abstract: U.S. Park Rangers at Mesa Verde National Park are seeking those responsible for the theft of a white utility trailer taken near the entrance to the park.

image.altText: A white trailer with Colorado plates (DSI238) under a cloudy sky.
image.title: Trailer - DSI-238
image.caption: The stolen white trailer with Colorado plates (DSI238)

title: Blue Ridge Parkway Issues Notice of Finding of No Significant Impact for Right of Way Permit Application
abstract: After careful review and public comment, the National Park Service has issued a Finding of No Significant Impact to permit a Right of Way permit for an underground natural gas pipeline within the Blue Ridge Parkway.

title: National Park Service acquires 105 acres of land adjacent to City of Rocks National Reserve
abstract: National Park Service purchases 105 acres in Graham Creek Canyon, expanding City of Rocks National Reserve.

image.altText: Photo is from the side of granite rock outcrop looking across a green lush canyon.
image.title: Graham Creek Canyon
image.caption: Summer sunrise overlooking Graham Canyon. Few have explored rugged beauty of this secluded landscape.

title: Park seeks help identifying historic homesites
abstract: Park volunteers and staff are seeking help to identify and document former homesites in the park. The public is invited to the King Family Library in Sevierville, TN on Saturday, December 10, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. to learn more about the project and to add copies of their historical records to the park’s collection.

image.altText: Black and white historic photo with a family of six people standing in front of a wooden home with a stone chimney.
image.title: Example of historic homesite image-Jim Kirkland home

title: Art in the Park at Indiana Dunes National Park
abstract: Join a local artist from the Art Barn to learn how to paint your own dunes-inspired artwork.

title: Everglades National Park celebrates 75 years with event on Dec. 3
abstract: On Sat., Dec. 3, Everglades National Park will celebrate its 75th Anniversary with a rededication ceremony, live music, historic reenactors, and tours of the new facilities in Flamingo. Participants will be among the first to see inside the newly renovated Guy Bradley Visitor Center.

title: Kinderhook Community to Commemorate Martin Van Buren’s Life in Graveside Ceremony
abstract: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site, the Friends of Lindenwald, and the Village of Kinderhook invite the community to participate on December 5th for the annual observance of Martin Van Buren’s birthday.

image.altText: Wreath Laying Ceremony at Martin Van Buren's Gravesite 2021
image.title: 2022 Ceremony for Martin Van Buren

relatedParks.fullName: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site
relatedParks.name: Martin Van Buren

title: NPS Announces 2023 Reduced Winter Services and Priority Snow Removal Routes
abstract: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area provides year-round recreational opportunities, however visitor services and maintenance operations are reduced during the winter months when staffing levels and visitation are at their lowest. This includes the closure of some roads and visitor use sites and reduced maintenance at others.

relatedParks.fullName: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
relatedParks.name: Delaware Water Gap

title: NPS Seeks Feedback on Draft Marine Management Plan and Environmental Assessment
abstract: The National Park Service is seeking feedback on a Glacier Bay National Park draft Marine Management Plan and Environmental Assessment between November 30 and December 30, 2022.

image.altText: starfish split level image
image.title: Sea star split level

title: Parking area improvement project begins next week at former site of U.S. Coast Guard Station
abstract: A project to improve a parking area at the former site of the Bodie Island Coast Guard Station is scheduled to begin Monday, Dec. 5, 2022. Through Feb. 2023, visitors should use Coquina Beach Access, located approximately three-tenths of a mile south of the project site.

title: Utility upgrades planned for Heart O’ the Hills Campground
abstract: In spring 2023, Olympic National Park will be rehabilitating the water and wastewater systems for the Heart O' the Hills Campground. The campground and Heart O' the Forest Trail will be closed during construction. The contract for this work was awarded in fall 2022.

title: Shenandoah National Park announces plans for the Old Rag pilot program
abstract: The requirement for a day-use ticket at Old Rag ended November 30, 2022.

title: National Park Service approves plan to repair Cape Hatteras Lighthouse
abstract: On Monday, Nov. 28, National Park Service (NPS) South Atlantic-Gulf Regional Director Mark Foust signed a Finding of No Significant Impact (FONSI) for the Cape Hatteras Lighthouse Repair and Landscape Improvement Project environmental assessment (EA) at Cape Hatteras National Seashore.

title: National Park Service invites public comment on proposed entrance fee increase at Acadia National Park
abstract: The National Park Service (NPS) is proposing to increase the entrance fee at Acadia National Park to support projects that benefit visitors and protect park resources. The new entrance fee would become effective starting in 2023 and be required year-round. The NPS is requesting feedback on the entrance fee increase during a 30-day public comment period that will be open from November 30 through December 29, 2022. Comments must be submitted online through the NPS Planning, Environment, and Public Comment website at go.nps.gov/AcadiaFeeIncrease.

title: Riverways to host holiday happenings
abstract: Memories of cookies and cider, sleigh rides, homemade gifts and ornaments, and warm gatherings of friends and family are all part of the spirit of Christmas in the Ozarks. Ozark National Scenic Riverways will celebrate the holiday season with special open house events at Eminence and Akers in December.

image.altText: Alley Mill is red in the middle of a snowstorm. Red holiday bows decorate the bridge leading to the spring and mill.
image.title: DSCF7621
image.caption: Alley Mill will be illuminated by candlelight during this special night-time holiday event.

title: Comunicado de prensa- Se extiende el periodo de comentarios del público del Plan de Manejo de Gatos Realengos y Evaluación Ambiental
abstract: La Superintendente Myrna I. Palfrey anunció que el periodo para recibir comentarios del público acerca del Plan de Manejo de Gatos Realengos y Evaluación Ambiental ha sido extendido hasta del 12 de diciembre de 2022.

title: Extension of Public Comment Period of the Free- Ranging Management Plan
abstract: Superintendent Myrna I. Palfrey announces that the period to receive public comments for the Free- Ranging Management Plan and Environmental Assessment has been extended until December 12, 2022.

title: First Family to light National Christmas Tree in President’s Park
abstract: President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will help celebrate the 2022 holiday season by lighting the National Christmas Tree at the 100th National Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony. Vice President Kamala Harris and Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff will also attend the lighting. The ceremony takes place on the Ellipse in President’s Park on Nov. 30.

title: National Park Service to implement traffic safety improvements in East Potomac Park
abstract: In order to improve pedestrian, cyclist and motorist safety in East Potomac Park, the National Park Service will replace one vehicle travel lane on Ohio Drive from the East Potomac Golf Course to Hains Point and back to Buckeye Drive with a new, dedicated bicycle and pedestrian lane

image.altText: Conceptual photo of vehicles, pedestrians and cyclists on a tree-lined road

title: Damage Assessments from Hurricane Nicole Continue
abstract: Canaveral National Seashore and the National Park Service’s Eastern Incident Management Team continue to assess damage to the national seashore from Hurricane Nicole. Preliminary reports show heavy impacts in the Playalinda District, with substantial damage to numerous boardwalks, parking lots, beach access points and sand dunes.

image.altText: Playalinda Beach
image.title: Nicole Update PD

title: Wilson’s Creek National Battlefield to eliminate entrance fee and pass sales in 2023
abstract: As of January 1, 2023, Wilson’s Creek National Battlefield will no longer charge an entrance fee to access park grounds. Operational hours for the visitor center, battlefield tour road, and trails will remain the same.

image.altText: Front of Visitor Center Building with Arrowhead on sign reading "Wilson's Creek National Battlefield, National Park Service, US Department of the Interior
image.title: VC Building
image.caption: Visitor Center at Wilson's Creek National Battlefield

title: Mount Rainier National Park Announces Winter 2022-23 Recreational Access Changes
abstract: Mount Rainier National Park announced updates today to winter 2022-23 recreational access, including changes to the Paradise access schedule. Beginning today, November 29, the park will maintain public vehicle access to Paradise on Saturdays and Sundays, but due to staffing limitations the road will be closed to public access during the week. The Longmire area will continue to be open seven days a week barring any major storm events. Park staff will continue to revisit the Paradise access schedule should staffing levels change during the winter season.

title: Zion National Park shares shuttle schedule and campground information for fall and winter
abstract: Fall has arrived at Zion National Park!  Every year, the National Park Service (NPS) adjusts shuttle schedules and campground availability to reflect the seasons. Here is what you need to know to plan your visit this fall or winter.

image.altText: Visitors wearing warm hats and coats walk in a paved area near the Zion Canyon Visitor Center
image.title: Visitors walk through Zion Canyon Visitor Center Plaza.
image.caption: Visitors at Zion Canyon Visitor Center Plaza in the fall.

title: Experience Historic Holidays at Hampton
abstract: Experience how the holiday season was celebrated by those who lived at worked at Hampton by exploring the stories of free and enslaved African Americans, indentured servants, and the Ridgely family on Saturday, December 10th.  Join park staff and volunteers for guided tours, traditional African American storytelling, living history, kid’s activities, a variety of holiday musical performances, and an open house exploration of the mansion decorated for Christmases from the Early Republic to the Twentieth Century.

image.altText: Holidays at Hampton
image.title: Holidays at Hampton Music Room
image.caption: Experience centuries of holiday traditions during our annual Holidays at Hampton event

title: National Park Service and Gateway Arch Park Foundation reach next milestone toward Old Courthouse renovation
abstract: $24,454,263 investment will restore and improve  the historic site of the pivotal Dred Scott case and hundreds suits for freedom as part of largest NPS public-private partnership

image.altText: image of the Old Courthouse
image.title: Old Courthouse, St. Louis
image.caption: Old Courthouse

title: Lindsey Kurnath Named Superintendent of Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River
abstract: National Park Service (NPS) Northeast Regional Director Gay Vietzke announces Lindsey Kurnath as the next superintendent of Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River, located in Pennsylvania and New York state.

image.altText: Lindsey Kurnath
image.title: Superintendent Lindsey Kurnath

title: Holiday Open House at George Washington Carver National Monument
abstract: Park and staff volunteer invite the public to a holiday celebration with seasonal music, crafts, and refreshments.

image.altText: Holiday Open House 2022
image.title: Holiday Open House 2022

title: Park plans 2023 lane closure on Spur for tunnel repairs
abstract: Park officials announced that traffic on the northbound Spur will be reduced to one lane on January 3 through April 7, 2023, to allow for tunnel repairs. Concrete barriers will be placed along the center line of the tunnel to allow crews to make repairs within the closed lane, while allowing through traffic on the open lane.

image.altText: A truck with a sign that says "Road Work Ahead" beside a line of orange cones approaching a tunnel.
image.title: Example of lane closure for Spur Tunnel work

title: Park is open with some closures as Mauna Loa erupts
abstract: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park remains open following a new eruption on Mauna Loa volcano that began in the summit caldera late Sunday night and migrated to the northeast rift zone Monday morning.

image.altText: Two volcanoes erupt and glow at the same time
image.title: Kilauea (left) and Mauna Loa (right) erupt at the same time
image.caption: Kīlauea summit and Mauna Loa summit erupt and glow together in the early morning

title: Star power from stage and screen set to celebrate the 100th National Christmas Tree Lighting
abstract: A star-studded lineup will take the stage to mark the 100th National Christmas Tree Lighting. This beloved American tradition, presented by the National Park Service (NPS) and the National Park Foundation (NPF), will now also feature musical performances by Yolanda Adams and Ariana DeBose. The official lighting of the National Christmas Tree on the Ellipse in President’s Park will take place on Nov. 30.

image.altText: Spensha Baker, Colton Dixon, Chevel Shepherd, Tucson Arizona Boys Chorus, U.S. Air Force Max Impact, West Tennessee Youth Chorus, Jessie James Decker, Eric Decker, and Decker children join Santa Claus on stage for a final song.
image.title: 2019 National Christmas Tree Lighting
image.caption: All the performers join Santa on stage for a final song at the 2019 National Christmas Tree Lighting.

title: Devils Tower National Monument Staff Attended a 2 Week Training for High-Angle Rope Rescue
abstract: Last month, Devils Tower staff attended a high-angle rope rescue course. This course was instructed within the monument by “Rigging for Rescue” out of Ouray, CO. The 2-week seminar included detailed instruction on high-angle rescue systems and how to use technical equipment for practical use.

image.altText: 4 photos rescue personnel lowering patients in a backboard down devils tower in various ways on a sunny day
image.title: Search and Rescue staff at Devils Tower in Training

title: Filming Permit will Impact the Fort Pulaski Entrance Area Monday through Wednesday
abstract: There will be a filming permit in effect in the park near the entrance station and bridge area from Monday, November 28th to Wednesday, November 30th. While the park will remain open to the public during these permitted filming activities, there will be the potential for traffic delays to and from the park.

title: Big Thicket to Host Three Volunteer Planting Events this Winter
abstract: Join Big Thicket staff for 3 volunteer events this winter, where you can plant native grasses and trees to help restore longleaf pine forest habitat.

image.altText: 2 young girls planting trees in a burned area of forest
image.title: Volunteers planting trees
image.caption: Young volunteers planting longleaf pines

title: Investigative Services Branch Case Update
abstract: Man sentenced to prison for sexual assault of a juvenile in Lake Mead National Recreation Area

title: Iron Plantation Christmas at Hopewell Furnace
abstract: The National Park Service (NPS) invites the public to celebrate an “Iron Plantation Christmas” and stroll through the historic community of Hopewell Furnace National Historic Site. This free event will take place on Saturday, December 3, from 10 am to 4 pm, and will feature Christmas as celebrated during the 19th century at Hopewell Furnace. The program will be presented rain or shine. Visitors will find that Christmas was a workday in the early 19th century. The bake ovens will be heating up special treats and the Blacksmiths will be clanging away. Visitors will be able to discover the customs, foods, and traditions of the holiday season from an early American perspective. The Berks and Chester County Master Gardeners will guide visitors in making holiday ornaments out of greens and other natural sprigs as a memento of their visit. Visitors will meet Der Belsnickel, a mischievous version of Santa Claus, who rewards good children with treats.

image.altText: Man dressed as Belsnickel character
image.title: Belsnickel
image.caption: Beware the Belsnickel

title: Christmas Bird Count at Indiana Dunes National Park
abstract: INDIANA DUNES NATIONAL PARK: On December 31st get outside and have fun helping with the Audubon Christmas Bird Count and make an important contribution to conservation. Tens of thousands of volunteers throughout the Americas take part in an adventure that has become a family tradition. Audubon and other organizations will use data collected in this longest running wildlife census to assess the health of bird populations and to guide conservation actions.

title: Zion National Park rescues one person and responds to one fatality in the Narrows
abstract: On the morning of Wednesday, November 23, Zion National Park shuttle drivers reported that visitors had encountered an injured man and a non-responsive woman in the Narrows. The Zion National Park Search and Rescue Team responded and found the man on Riverside Walk. Team members transported the man to the Zion Emergency Operations Center. Farther up the Narrows, other team members found a non-responsive woman in the Virgin River. First responders administered emergency aid, but they determined she was deceased.

image.altText: A truck with red rock in the background. The truck is labeled Zion Search and Rescue.
image.title: Zion Search and Rescue Vehicle
image.caption: File photo of Zion National Park Search and Rescue vehicle.

title: Cold Harbor Battlefield Visitor Center to Close for Winter
abstract: Richmond National Battlefield Park today announced that the Cold Harbor Battlefield Visitor Center (5515 Anderson Wright Drive) will close for the winter season beginning Thursday, December 1. It will reopen on Wednesday, March 1, 2023.

image.altText: a small brick visitor center flanked by a flagpole and a freestanding interpretive sign.
image.title: Cold Harbor Visitor Center
image.caption: Cold Harbor Battlefield Visitor Center

title: Remembering the Modoc War at 150: Special Programs in Malin and Klamath Falls, Oregon
abstract: Join Lava Beds National Monument along with community and tribal partners will be hosting a series of special programs throughout the Klamath Basin.

title: Carlsbad Caverns National Park Closed During Upcoming Holidays
abstract: Carlsbad Caverns National Park will be closed on November 24, December 25, and January 1. This includes the visitor center, cavern, roads, and trails.

title: Remembering the Modoc War at 150: Special Events, 2022-2023
abstract: From November 2022 through April 2023, Lava Beds National Monument will be remembering the 150th anniversary of the Modoc War.

title: Why Follow John Ross?
abstract: On Saturday, December 10, at 2 pm, Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park will provide a special 30-minute program about John Ross and why he was chosen Principal Chief of the Cherokee Nation.

title: Allen Dart Presents for Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series December 7, 2022
abstract: The Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series takes place weekly through January 18, 2023. On December 7, 2022 Casa Grande Ruins will host Allen Dart at 1:00 pm. Mr. Dart will present "Set in Stone but not in Meaning: Southwestern Rock Art". The speaker series will continue every Wednesday at 1:00 pm through January 18.

title: Cultural Demonstrator Series transitions to Grand Canyon Visitor Center for winter season
abstract: Starting on December 2, 2022, through February 26, 2023, the Cultural Demonstrator Series will transition to the Grand Canyon Visitor Center (GCVC) on the South Rim. Every Friday through Sunday, artists from traditionally associated tribes of Grand Canyon will be in the lobby from 10 a.m.-4 p.m.

image.altText: Three Dine tribal members demonstrate carding wool at the Grand Canyon Visitor Center
image.title: GCVC cultural demonstration
image.caption: Chasingwind Cultural Consulting demonstrates the traditional Navajo way of carding wool at the Grand Canyon Visitor Center, 2013.

title: Dune Ridge Trail Hike at National Park
abstract: INDIANA DUNES NATIONAL PARK: Join a ranger for a hike on the Indiana Dunes National Park’s Dune Ridge Trail on Saturday, November 26, from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm. Hike through an oak savanna as you gradually climb uphill to enjoy sweeping views of the Great Marsh from the top of a dune ridge.

title: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park & Preserve Seeks Candidates for Subsistence Resource Commission
abstract: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve is accepting applications through January 30, 2023, for seats on the Wrangell-St. Elias National Park Subsistence Resource Commission (SRC). The SRC provides a venue for local subsistence users to provide input into the management of subsistence resources in Wrangell-St. Elias National Park. It was established under the provisions of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act (ANILCA) and charged with recommending a program for subsistence hunting in the park.

relatedParks.fullName: Wrangell - St Elias National Park & Preserve
relatedParks.name: Wrangell - St Elias

title: 2023 Community Artists in the Parks Announced
abstract: The National Park Service Southeast Utah Group is pleased to announce Jess Hough as the 2023 Community Artist in the Parks (CAIP). Jess Hough is a local carpenter/handyman and artist based in Moab. Primarily an illustrator, she’s recently been working on developing DIY methods for at-home printmaking using reclaimed/recycled materials. Jess enjoys working on landscapes and environments inspired by red rock canyons and all the amazing natural features of Utah's deserts. About her upcoming tenure as Community Artist, Jess says, "I'm looking forward to spending more time in the parks and working on some exciting new projects!"

image.altText: Jess Hough sketches using a pencil and notebook in front of reddish-orange cliffs.
image.title: Jess Hough in a brown sweater sketching in front of reddish-orange cliffs.
